channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DATACMNS-854] Custom implementation of repository fails when overriding methods containing generics
item.description:
I am using the method for creating custom implementation of repositories, as described (among other places) here. This works great for just about all methods, including methods from the standard CrudRepository and PagingAndSortingRepository like Page<T> findAll(Pageable pageable). However, this does not work if the method defined in CrudRepository or PagingAndSortingRepository contains parameters with generics, like T findOne(ID id).

Why am I doing this you ask? Well, I am trying to find a work around while waiting for DATACMNS-293. This allows me to implement the methods manually, while keeping all the goodness of the restful exposure code as-is, which given QueryDSL is suprisingly simple and I am nearly questioning the need for the solution in DATACMNS-293...

The following patch fixes the issue for me, but I am not able to see if this has further unwanted ramifications:

iff --git a/src/main/java/org/springframework/data/repository/core/support/DefaultRepositoryInformation.java b/src/main/java/org/springframework/data/repository/core/support/DefaultRepositoryInformation.java
 
index 48bcdac..785c575 100644
 
--- a/src/main/java/org/springframework/data/repository/core/support/DefaultRepositoryInformation.java
 
+++ b/src/main/java/org/springframework/data/repository/core/support/DefaultRepositoryInformation.java
 
@@ -356,7 +356,7 @@ class DefaultRepositoryInformation implements RepositoryInformation {
 
                                        return false;
 
                                }
 
                        } else {
 
-                               if (!types[i].equals(parameterType)) {
 
+                               if (!types[i].isAssignableFrom(parameterType)) {
 
                                        return false;
 
                                }
 
                        }
item.summary: Custom implementation of repository fails when overriding methods containing generics

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Any chance you add a test case to show what exactly is failing and what you'd expect to work. Could be it's not working by design as a change like that might cause ambiguities in other places.

Here is a test case I believe exactly reproduces the issue. I do not think this is outside of the design since it is only a slight variation on existing functionality. The test case below is based on the test 'discoversCustomlyImplementedCrudMethod'.
—

diff --git a/src/test/java/org/springframework/data/repository/core/support/DefaultRepositoryInformationUnitTests.java b/src/test/java/org/springframework/data/repository/core/support/DefaultRepositoryInformationUnitTests.java
 
index 78ab790..1e6fc0b 100644
 
--- a/src/test/java/org/springframework/data/repository/core/support/DefaultRepositoryInformationUnitTests.java
 
+++ b/src/test/java/org/springframework/data/repository/core/support/DefaultRepositoryInformationUnitTests.java
 
@@ -95,6 +95,19 @@ public class DefaultRepositoryInformationUnitTests {
 
   }
 
 
   @Test
 
+  public void discoversCustomlyImplementedCrudMethodWithGenerics() throws SecurityException, NoSuchMethodException {
 
+
 
+    RepositoryMetadata metadata = new DefaultRepositoryMetadata(FooRepository.class);
 
+               RepositoryInformation information = new DefaultRepositoryInformation(metadata, CrudRepository.class,
 
+                               customImplementation.getClass());
 
+
 
+               Method source = FooRepositoryCustom.class.getMethod("validate", Object.class);
 
+               Method expected = customImplementation.getClass().getMethod("validate", Object.class);
 
+
 
+    assertThat(information.getTargetClassMethod(source), is(expected));
 
+  }
 
+
 
+  @Test
 
   public void considersIntermediateMethodsAsFinderMethods() {
 
 
     RepositoryMetadata metadata = new DefaultRepositoryMetadata(ConcreteRepository.class);
 
@@ -248,8 +261,11 @@ public class DefaultRepositoryInformationUnitTests {
 
     User findOne(Long primaryKey);
 
   }
 
 
-       interface FooRepositoryCustom {
 
+  interface FooSuperInterfaceWithGenerics<T> {
 
+    T validate(T entity);
 
+  }
 
 
+  interface FooRepositoryCustom extends FooSuperInterfaceWithGenerics<User> {
 
     User save(User user);
 
   }

—
Oh, and I do not think my suggested fix (in bug text above) is the correct one. Its too simplistic and probably to many ways it can match the wrong method. But it does work for me

After more debugging and testing, I think the following is an improvement on the original patch:
—

diff --git a/src/main/java/org/springframework/data/repository/core/support/DefaultRepositoryInformation.java b/src/main/java/org/springframework/data/repository/core/support/DefaultRepositoryInformation.java
 
index 48bcdac..79a2100 100644
 
--- a/src/main/java/org/springframework/data/repository/core/support/DefaultRepositoryInformation.java
 
+++ b/src/main/java/org/springframework/data/repository/core/support/DefaultRepositoryInformation.java
 
@@ -356,7 +373,10 @@ class DefaultRepositoryInformation implements RepositoryInformation {
 
                                        return false;
 
                                }
 
                        } else {
 
-                               if (!types[i].equals(parameterType)) {
 
+                               // We must either have an exact match, or,
 
+                if (!types[i].equals(parameterType) &&
 
+                   // the tpes must be assignable _and_ signature definition types must be identical.
 
+                        !(types[i].isAssignableFrom(parameterType) && types[i].equals(method.getParameterTypes()[i]))) {
 
                                        return false;
 
                                }
 
                        }

(Please feel free to refactor the boolean expression, I tried simply to keep the changes to a minimum for clarity).

Not only will it now validate that the types are assignable, but also require that the signatures (without considering generics) is required to be identical. This, if I am not mistaken, should remove the possibility of an incorrect match.

Before this patch, only non-generic methods from CrudRepository and PagingAndSortingRepository could be overridden with a custom implementation. With this patch, all methods can be overridden, which I believe is an increase in consistency. The one inconsistency is search methods 'findByXxx(...)' that a user defines in the Repository interface. There seems no way one can ignore the default implementation and write a custom implementation..

Thanks!

We don't work with patch snippets posted to JIRA tickets. If you want to submit code, please provide a proper pull request, including a test case that shows the effect of the proposed change. You might wanna read up on the contribution guidelines to prepare the PR.

Of course, totally understand and thanks for the link to the guidelines.

I have done my best to follow the instructions, please find my pull request here: https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-commons/pull/162

Please advice if I have done something wrong, this will be my first submission.

Thanks!
That's merged and polished. Feel free to give the snapshot builds a spin.

Thanks! Much appreciated!

Tested 1.11.5.BUILD-SNAPSHOT and works-for-me.

In the DefaultRepositoryInformationUnitTests, the given FooRepository's save() method can never be called. Because both CrudRepository and FooRepositoryCustom have save() methods with equivalent signatures, the compiler does not know which one to pick.

You can test this by trying:

        FooRepository repository = mock(FooRepository.class);
 
        repository.save(mock(User.class));

java: reference to save is ambiguous
both method <S>save(S) in org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository and method save(org.springframework.data.repository.core.support.DefaultRepositoryInformationUnitTests.User) in org.springframework.data.repository.core.support.DefaultRepositoryInformationUnitTests.FooRepositoryCustom match

What we've always done in the past is provide a custom save() method which overrides the default save() behavior (for various reasons) and this always worked (up until 1.11.2 at least). Now when upgrading to 1.12.2, our stategy no longer works as isCustomMethod(MyRepository.class.getMethod(save, Object.class)) always returns false.

To test this, suppose we added a BossRepositoryCustom interface to the DefaultRepositoryInformationUnitTests:

    interface BossRepositoryCustom {
 
        Boss save(Boss boss);
 
    }

And added the following test, it would fail:

    @Test
 
    public void discoversCustomlyImplementedCrudMethodWithGenericParameters() throws SecurityException, NoSuchMethodException {
 
 
 
        BossRepositoryCustom customImplementation = mock(BossRepositoryCustom.class);
 
        RepositoryMetadata metadata = new DefaultRepositoryMetadata(BossRepository.class);
 
        RepositoryInformation information = new DefaultRepositoryInformation(metadata, CrudRepository.class,
 
                                                                             customImplementation.getClass());
 
 
 
        Method customBaseRepositoryMethod = BossRepository.class.getMethod("save", Object.class);
 
        assertTrue(information.isCustomMethod(customBaseRepositoryMethod));
 
    }

This same test would succeed previously.

I think the specific change that is causing this to now fail is in DefaultRepositoryInformation.parametersMatch():

			if (!type.isAssignableFrom(parameterType) || !type.equals(methodParameterTypes[i])) {
 
				return false;
 
			}

type.isAssignableFrom(parameterType) is true but type.equals(methodParameterTypes[i]) is false because methodParameterTypes[i] is Object.class while type and parameterType are both MyEntity.class.

Unless I am missing something, I think we can no longer override crud method that take generic parameters.

Did you change Mockito versions (moving from 1.x to 2.x) with the upgrade by any chance? We have a separate branch for our upcoming Java 8 upgrade and I basically ran into the exactly same problem and it could be tracked back to a change in behavior in Mockito. I already have a fix for that locally but generally speaking, for me this was a problem only in the context of mocking and shouldn't actually be tied to the Spring Data version.

Either way, would you mind creating another ticket to keep track of that? Even if the scenario is as I described above (i.e. a mocking / test-only problem) we could see whether my fix solves the issue for you, too.

Hi Oliver,

Thanks for the quick reply. We are still using Mockito 1.x (1.10.19). Our main project was already on Java 8 but we did upgrade our Spring Data MyBatis project to Java 8 in the process. It was in a separate collection of utility libraries that was still on Java 7.

In case you were wondering, we are using MyBatis (and MySQL) for various reasons. However, this makes it very difficult to change technologies in the future and we were talking about experimenting with different storage technologies. Basically, I created Spring Data MyBatis so we could eventually do that. All it does really is delegates to MyBatis mappers, with a bit of logic (save becomes insert/update for example). Anyway, the move to Spring Data has also greatly cleaned up our code by enforcing a consistent way of both writing our mappers as well as interacting with our new repositories.

I will create another ticket and will try to create a self-contained example that reproduces the issue without mocking (after all, these are our unit tests that are failing on our end). If I can't, I'll create one about mocking only.

Thanks!
FYI, I opened DATACMNS-912 to track the issue.
